techmeme.title: Relyance AI, which helps companies comply with data privacy regulations, raised a $32.1M Series B led by Thomvest, bringing its total funding to ~$59M (Kyle Wiggers/TechCrunch)
Sources: Pittsburgh-based Abridge, which uses AI to transcribe doctors' conversations with their patients, raised $250M at a $2.5B pre-money valuation (The Information)
Elon Musk claims "unsupervised" FSD will come to TX and CA in 2025 for select models and shows a Tesla Robovan, meant to be autonomous and carry up to 20 people (Aarian Marshall/Wired)
Elon Musk reveals the Tesla Cybercab, saying "you will be able to buy one" for under $30,000 and that he expects the robotaxi to be in production "before 2027" (Rebecca Bellan/TechCrunch)
A look at the possible outcomes of the Google Search antitrust trial, including the very likely scenario that Google's default search engine deals won't survive (Casey Newton/Platformer)
